resources.string: Personalized learning journeys designed to provide complete coverage of class syllabus
Revision and practice sessions to perfect the understanding of concepts
Practice to perfection with topic wise tests customized to the learning requirement of every schoolBO
In-depth analysis based on tests and personalised learning paths adopted by the student
Weak in ""1"" Subject\n""4"" Chapters need practice\n""12"" Topics need attention
You know that when an object changes it\'s position with time then it\'s in ""motion"" otherwise it\'s in ""rest"".
Motion and Rest are ""relative terms"". Relative means with respect to each other.
As the earth is rotating - so is your home, but it\'s not moving with respect to you so it is in rest. But if someone looks from the moon then with respect to him it\'s in motion.

An object is treated as ""point object"" if the size of the object is much smaller than distance traveled by it in a reasonable time.\n\nIf object ""moves in straight line"" then it's ""Rectilinear motion"".
""Scalar"" means ""only magnitude"" and ""Vector"" means ""both direction and magnitude"".

""Distance"" is length or ""distance traveled"" and is a ""Scalar"" quantity.\n\n""Displacement"" is the ""shortest distance between two points"" along with its direction and is thus a ""Vector"" quantity.
